subtitle: They protect against diseases
title: Why get him vaccinated?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Getting your baby immunised is one of the best things you can do as a mother. 

Ask for your baby’s immunisation card at your first doctor’s appointment. Take care not to lose it and take it to every doctor’s appointment.

Remember: you and your baby need to get immunised when you are both well and do not have the disease. A vaccination cannot cure the disease once it has started.

If you and your baby are immunised, it means that you can fight serious illnesses if you come into contact with them. You cannot get immunised if you are already sick, so do it when you are both well.

Immunisation helps your baby to fight off some of the most dangerous illnesses. This will protect you both from suffering and distress. No mother likes seeing her baby sick. 

Your baby needs to get immunised while he is well and it is important that you get it done at the right time.

Your baby will need more than 1 dose of some immunisations. If you want to know what immunisations your baby needs and when, talk to a doctor. They will tell you when to get your baby immunised.
